page.title: 05INDUSTRY
page.content: Renfrew District is a{Special {Development Area.}The need for this special help arises from the recent rapid decline of many of the traditional industries, eg ship- building activity and its ancillary industries have completely disappeared from the area in the last 5 years. Today the{main employers}of labour are Local Administration (60%); Babcock Power (15%) and Glasgow Airport (8%). Babcock Power, a major British boiler manufacturer, exports its boilers world wide, mainly to be used in power stations. In 1985 because the economic climate the Company has announced a 15% cut back in its workforce. This will badly affect the town where there is already rising unemployment. The company has just won a Â£1m order to build parts for Trident submarines which may provide future employment.
